items.title: Author intent command for pre-writing compression
items.description: /author:intent - Takes raw, unstructured input (voice notes, transcripts, bullets, conversation dumps) and produces a chapter-level intent brief that defines what the chapter must accomplish and why, without generating prose. Output: chapter-X.intent.md alongside chapter files. Schema includes: core thesis, chapter role in book arc, key arguments/moves, evidence needed, emotional arc, reader takeaway, exclusions, confidence rating, open questions. Behavioral constraint: NO prose generation, NO voice imitation, NO gap-filling with invented content. Flags gaps instead of guessing. Primary user: professional author/ghostwriter managing messy upstream client inputs.

items.title: Client workflow analysis - author plugin fit assessment
items.description: Spike to analyze client discovery call notes against existing author plugin tooling. Goals: (1) Identify which existing author commands serve the client's workflow, (2) Find gaps where new commands or enhancements are needed, (3) Formulate a service offer based on tooling capabilities. Client was referred based on the author plugin specifically.

items.title: Evaluate planning-with-files approach for context management
items.description: Spike to evaluate OthmanAdi/planning-with-files repository - a 'Manus-style' persistent markdown planning methodology. Uses 3-file pattern (task_plan.md, findings.md, progress.md) with hooks for automatic plan re-reading and status reminders. Key questions: (1) Does this solve problems our .plan/ directory doesn't? (2) Are there patterns worth adopting? (3) How does it compare to our TodoWrite checkpoint approach (ADR-038)?
items.resolution: Do not adopt full approach. Extracted '2-Action Rule' via PostToolUse hook in pro/hooks/hooks.json (fires on browser snapshot/screenshot tools). Our .plan/ + checkpoint pattern is superior for Claude Code-native workflows.

items.title: Evaluate Gastown multi-agent orchestration framework
items.description: Spike to evaluate Steve Yegge's Gastown project (github.com/steveyegge/gastown) for potential adoption. Gastown is a multi-agent orchestration layer built on Beads that coordinates 20-30 Claude Code agents across multiple repositories. Key features: Mayor pattern for orchestration, git worktree hooks for persistence, convoys for work batching, TOML formulas for workflows. Questions answered: (1) Does Gastown solve problems ccplugins has? No - single-agent workflow. (2) Are patterns extractable? Minimal - worktrees already documented. (3) Future relevance? Only if multi-agent Claude becomes standard.
items.resolution: Do not adopt. Gastown solves multi-agent problems that don't exist in single-agent workflow. Requires Beads (already rejected in ADR-058).

items.title: Migrate backlog IDs to short hashes
items.description:
Convert sequential integer IDs to collision-resistant short hashes (e.g., `b-a1f3`) after #78 is complete.

**Why:** Future-proofs against multi-branch backlog edits where two branches could pick the same sequential ID.

**Migration steps:**
1. Generate 4-char hex hash for each item (from title + createdAt)
2. Update `id` field: `78` → `b-a1f3`
3. Update `fingerprint` fields: `spike|77|...` → `spike|b-a1f3|...`
4. Scan `.plan/` directories for ID references, update them
5. Update checkpoint.json files if they reference IDs
6. Remove `lastSequence` (no longer needed)
7. Update backlog commands to generate hashes instead of incrementing

**Prerequisite:** Complete #78 first (fewer items to migrate).

**Format:** `b-{4-char-hex}` - short, human-referenceable, collision-resistant.

items.title: Archive resolved backlog items for token conservation
items.description:
Move resolved items from backlog.json to backlog-archive.json to reduce token consumption during backlog operations.

**Problem:** backlog.json is ~1000 lines with many resolved items. Every /pro:backlog, /pro:backlog.resume, and /pro:roadmap call reads the full file, wasting tokens on historical items.

**Solution:**
1. Create `.plan/backlog-archive.json` for resolved items
2. Update backlog commands to auto-archive items with `status: resolved` older than 7 days
3. Keep `lastSequence` in main file (IDs never reused)
4. /pro:roadmap 'RECENTLY COMPLETED' section reads from both files
5. Optional: /pro:backlog.archive command to manually trigger archiving

**Expected benefit:** Active backlog drops from ~1000 to ~200-300 lines, faster operations, lower token cost.

items.title: Evaluate Beads (bd) AI context framework for ccplugins
items.description: Spike to evaluate Steve Yegge's Beads project (github.com/steveyegge/beads) for potential adoption. Beads is a Git-backed graph issue tracker designed for AI coding agents with features like: hash-based task IDs, dependency tracking, JSONL storage in .beads/, SQLite caching, and semantic summarization for token conservation. Questions to answer: (1) Does Beads solve problems our backlog.json doesn't? (2) What's the migration cost? (3) Partial adoption options? (4) Does the dependency graph add value for our workflow?
items.resolution: Do not adopt. Created chore #78 for token-conserving archive feature instead.

items.title: dev.setup uses wrong port ranges and confusing server naming
items.description:
Three bugs in /pro:dev.setup:

1. **Server naming**: Fallback template uses 'dev' as server name, causing confusing 'npx dev dev' commands
2. **Port allocation**: Uses sequential low ports (3000, 4000) instead of random high ports - conflicts with 20-40 concurrent projects
3. **Dependencies**: Installation is optional, causing first-run failures when tsx not available

**Root causes:**
- Line 354: Hardcoded 'dev' as fallback name
- Lines 143-184: Sequential scan of commonly-used 4000/6000/7000 ranges
- Lines 299-308: Dependency install is optional prompt

**Fix:**
- Smart naming: Detect server type (web, api, worker) from script content
- Random high ports: 50000-58999 primary, 9000-9899 secondary
- Mandatory deps: Remove optional prompt, verify tsx installed

items.title: Implement /pro:demo command for quick project walkthrough
items.description: Implement /pro:demo - a lightweight, interactive command that walks users through a project's features. Unlike /onboarding (setup), /wtf (analysis), or /handoff (docs), this focuses on 'show me what this does'. Key behaviors: (1) quick scan - what is this project, what can run, (2) feature discovery - detect dev servers, CLIs, APIs, tests, (3) guided walkthrough - start things with permission, show URLs, (4) key docs pointer - README, docs/, CLAUDE.md, (5) cleanup - stop any started processes. Read-only, non-destructive, menu-based navigation. Based on spike #74 findings.

items.title: Lightweight demo/tour command for quick project walkthrough
items.description: Create a lightweight /pro:demo (or /pro:tour) command that walks users through a project's features interactively. Unlike /onboarding (setup-focused), /wtf (analysis-focused), or /handoff (documentation-focused), this command focuses on 'show me what this does' - starting servers, running CLIs, pointing to key docs. Hand-holding walkthrough style. Key behaviors: (1) detect runnable entry points (dev server, CLI, tests), (2) start them with user permission, (3) highlight key features and docs, (4) guided interactive exploration. Fills the gap for 'I forgot what this project does, just show me.'

items.title: Add self-service compilation tooling to /author:init
items.description: Enhance /author:init to generate package.json with npm scripts and bundled compile-latex.mjs/preview-pdf.mjs scripts. Enables authors to run `npm run preview` to generate PDF without invoking Claude Code. Based on spike #72 findings. Uses ADR-010 pattern for bundled bin assets.

items.title: Extract Claude Code book niceties to Author plugin
items.description: Spike to identify gaps between hand-crafted book projects (like Claude Code book) and what /author:init generates. Key findings: (1) Missing scripts/ directory with npm compile/preview commands, (2) Missing .claude/book-rules.md for canonical rules, (3) Incomplete .gitignore for LaTeX intermediates, (4) No README.md or doc/README.md generated. High-priority: add package.json + scripts for self-service compilation (npm run preview) so authors don't need Claude Code just to preview PDF.

items.title: Author publish command for traditional publishing pipeline
items.description: /author:publish - Traditional publishing pipeline command. Transforms a book concept into publisher-ready submission artifacts and submission tracking. Phased pipeline with checkpoints: (1) SCAN (optional) - go/no-go concept validation, (2) QUERY - agent query letter generation, (3) PROPOSAL - full book proposal, (4) TARGETS - curated agent target map, (5) LAUNCH - submission tracking + advance framing. Outputs stored in book/publish/ with dual JSON+Markdown for tracking. Creates ADR-054 to document reversal of ADR-028's artifact generation stance (this is opt-in intentional invocation, not automation theater).

items.title: Web-check integration & Claude-free CLI for permissionless proof
items.description: Explore integrating web-check.xyz for website analysis and investigate building a Claude-free CLI for permissionless proof. Key questions: (1) Can web-check provide 'walk-in' ammunition for cold outreach? (2) Can we build permissionless proof without LLM tokens - what's deterministic vs requires reasoning? (3) Architecture options: integrate web-check API, self-host web-check-api (Go), or build our own CLI using existing tools (Lighthouse, SSL checkers, DNS tools).
items.resolution: Documented in ADR-053 and audit-site product brief. Key finding: CHECK phase can be ~90% deterministic (zero tokens), but PARITY/ELEVATE require Claude vision. Recommended: build npx audit-site CLI as standalone package.

items.title: Work commands not creating branch before fix
items.description:
Critical bug: /pro:bug (and all work-initiating commands) allows investigation and potentially fixes to happen on main before branch is created. The command step ordering puts branch creation at steps 3-5, after plan mode and questions. Per ADR-017, branches must be created 'at invocation time' - immediately when command starts.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Run /pro:bug with a bug description
2. Claude starts investigating immediately without creating branch first
3. Fix may be implemented on main

**Root cause:** Command instructions put branch creation after plan mode entry and info gathering instead of FIRST.

**Fix:** Restructure all 5 work-initiating commands to create branch as step 0, before any other work.

items.title: Expand Bounty Scout to GitHub-native sources
items.description: Expand /pro:bounty.scout to discover paid/monetizable opportunities beyond Algora.io. Phase 1 adds GitHub-native discovery: (1) Paid Issue Signals - search issues with keywords like 'bounty', 'paid', 'would pay' and labels like help-wanted, (2) Sponsors-Enabled Repositories - detect repos with GitHub Sponsors and flag monetizable issues, (3) Urgency Signals - detect issues with keywords like 'regression', 'release blocker', 'urgent'. Unified list with source as metadata, confidence tiers instead of fake dollar amounts. Preserves Scout→Recon→Hunter pipeline compatibility.

items.title: Production-ready coding skill
items.description: Explore mechanisms to ensure Claude Code follows production-ready practices by default (use real loggers not console.log, proper error handling, externalized config). Investigating skill vs subagent vs enhanced CLAUDE.md rules. Goal: production patterns without requiring user to specify per-project.

items.title: Bounty Hunter - automated bounty discovery and execution
items.description: Add /pro:bounty.scout and /pro:bounty.hunter commands for automated OSS bounty discovery, triage, and execution. Scout mode: discovery + triage only, surfaces top candidate with TAKE/SKIP recommendation. Hunter mode: full execution including fork, implementation, tests, and PR creation with human checkpoint. Hard-coded to Algora.io for v1. Encodes maintainer psychology and decision compression, not just code generation. Goals: reduce cognitive overhead of bounty triage, compress search→decision→implementation loop from hours to minutes, establish repeatable $1-2k/month baseline.

items.title: Document shell environment setup for optional MCP servers
items.description: Update pro/readme.md to document the correct shell configuration for optional MCP servers. Add instructions for GITHUB_TOKEN (shadcn-ui) and dynamic SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY extraction from running local Supabase. Includes robust one-liner that handles edge cases like stopped services.

items.title: Plugin manifest config errors (4 issues)
items.description:
Four errors shown in /plugin UI: (1) Missing SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY env var, (2) Missing GITHUB_TOKEN env var, (3) Agents path not found despite files existing, (4) Duplicate hooks file - hooks/hooks.json auto-loaded by convention but also declared explicitly.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open /plugin → Installed → select 'pro'
2. View errors section

**Root causes:**
- Errors 1-2: Optional env vars not set (not bugs)
- Error 3: Glob pattern or path resolution issue
- Error 4: Manifest declares hooks path that's auto-loaded by Claude Code convention

items.title: Content Fighter dual-agent refinement system
items.description: Dual-agent iterative content refinement loop that scores and rewrites content until it achieves 10/10. Content Fighter A (Critic) scrutinizes content using a ruthless 5-axis scoring rubric (Authority, Directionality, Founder Pull, Action Gravity, Signal Density). Content Fighter B (Rewriter) applies the feedback. Loop continues until 10/10 with verbose progress shown each round. Command-only architecture (/pro:content-fight). No iteration limit, no config - 10/10 is the only acceptable outcome.

items.title: Multi-proof marketplace support
items.description: Enable multiple proofs per website with marketplace-ready metadata. Features: (1) New slug format: proof-{domain}-{YYMMDD}{seq} for uniqueness and sortability, (2) Interactive prompt when URL has existing proofs - create new or update, (3) Dual storage: central registry (.plan/proofs/index.json) + per-proof manifest (proof.json), (4) Rich marketplace metadata: thumbnails, tags, pricing tier, showcase status, issue counts, parity scores. Enables: side-by-side comparison of software evolution, portfolio growth for marketplace, re-running proofs on updated sites, and future marketplace features.

items.title: GitHub Pages automation skill
items.description: Create /pro:gh-pages skill for fully automated GitHub Pages deployment. Uses gh CLI API to enable Pages (POST /repos/{owner}/{repo}/pages with gh-pages branch source), pushes built assets via gh-pages npm package, waits for propagation, and returns live URL. Solves the problem where permissionless-proof and other commands output 'Manual Steps Required' for Pages setup. Skill can be called by any command needing static site deployment. Falls back to clear guidance if API fails (permissions, private repos, etc.).

items.title: Chrome Extension Developer skill
items.description: Create a skill (+ subagent for proactive invocation) that codifies Chrome extension development knowledge. Covers: Manifest V3 patterns, Chrome Web Store publishing lifecycle, extension status API checking, testing/debugging strategies, and project structure guidance. Based on learnings from building 'Conversation Titles for ChatGPT' extension. Patterns and decision frameworks only - no hardcoded templates that can rot.

items.title: Permissionless proof parity failures - multiple issues
items.description:
Three interconnected bugs in /pro:permissionless-proof:

1. **Excessive human intervention** - Asks for confirmation at phase transitions when it should be autonomous
2. **CHECK phase not finding problems** - Reports 0 issues on real production sites. Missing content/copy audit dimension. Needs to be more aggressive to provide sales talking points.
3. **PARITY not achieving parity** - Claims 98% but produces 60-70% match. Example: gardensdentistrypb.com clone has wrong colors (red testimonials vs navy), cramped spacing, dark service cards vs light. Vision scoring is too generous.

Blocks core value proposition - can't use for cold outreach without manual rework.

items.title: npx dev port command for forced port changes
items.description: Add `npx dev port <server> <port>` CLI subcommand to dev.ts for manually setting server ports. Addresses the issue where /pro:dev.setup or npx dev init assigns undesired ports (e.g., 8080). Features: (1) Updates preferredPort in .dev/servers.json, (2) Auto-restarts server if currently running on old port, (3) Validates port availability before setting, (4) Follows command-first CLI pattern from ADR-011.

items.title: Universal Content Retriever (UCR) skill
items.description: Claude skill for reliable, deterministic retrieval of any public web content. Solves the inconsistency problem where URLs sometimes resolve fully, sometimes partially, sometimes blocked. Features: (1) Tiered retrieval pipeline (WebFetch → Playwright → user paste), (2) Platform-aware extraction for X, LinkedIn, YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, Pinterest, blogs, (3) Normalized ContentObject schema for consistent reasoning, (4) Silent on success, report only on deviation, (5) Fail-soft with actionable recovery paths. v1 scope: public content only, no caching, skill-only architecture.

items.title: Product brief creates single file instead of versioned briefs
items.description:
/pro:product.brief creates a single .plan/product/brief.md file, which is misleading for mature products adding new feature briefs. ADR-031 specifies 'timestamped files' but implementation uses single file.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Work on a product (brief created outside system)
2. Run /pro:product.brief for a new feature idea
3. Command creates brief.md as if it's THE product brief

**Fix:** Transform brief.md into an index linking to timestamped briefs in briefs/ subdirectory. Format: YYYY-MM-DD-{slugified-title}.md

items.title: Permissionless Proof CHECK + DX improvements
items.description:
Evolve the permissionless proof system from static visual parity generator to customer-experience evidence engine.

CHECK EXTENSION:
- Interaction audit (nav, CTAs, forms, scrolling, modals)
- Dead-end detection
- Trust/credibility signals
- Tablet viewport (768×1024) + optional WebKit pass
- Operator translation layer
- Web-accessible evidence index at /evidence/

DX IMPROVEMENTS:
- Domain-scoped output directory (proof-{domain-slug})
- Auto git init with initial commit
- Vite base path fix for GitHub Pages
- npm scripts: build, deploy, deploy:init, open
- Default .gitignore generation

Success: 3-7 indisputable issues per proof, single-command deploy+open, evidence accessible on phone mid-conversation.

items.title: /pro:chain - Sequential command execution
items.description:
Create /pro:chain command that runs multiple /pro:* commands in sequence. Each command completes before the next starts.

Usage: /pro:chain chore, supabase.local

Features:
- Comma-separated command names
- Arguments via quoting: /pro:chain "feature add dark mode", pr
- Wait for interactive commands to complete
- Stop chain on failure or user abort

Future: parallel execution, conditional chaining, named presets.

items.title: /pro:request - Twitter feature requests to maintainers
items.description:
Create /pro:request command that formats feature requests as tweets and helps submit them to project maintainers on X/Twitter.

Features:
- Takes feature request description
- Formats as concise tweet (≤280 chars)
- Tags appropriate maintainer (@bcherny for Claude Code)
- Copies to clipboard AND opens twitter.com/intent/tweet URL

Could be generic (specify maintainer handle) or have presets for common projects.

items.title: Remove slow ADR check from /pro:pr.merged
items.description:
The /pro:pr.merged command includes an ADR existence check that is slow and almost always results in 'ADRs already exist for the X branch. Skipping ADR creation.' This check adds unnecessary latency to what should be a quick cleanup operation. ADRs are created during feature work, not at merge time.

Fix: Remove or significantly speed up the ADR check in pr.merged.md. The command should focus on cleanup (archiving planning docs, deleting branches) without the overhead of ADR detection.

items.title: Auto visual parity verification for permissionless proof
items.description:
Enhance /pro:permissionless-proof with automated visual parity checking loop. After PARITY phase builds, automatically:

1. Screenshot source (cached) and parity build
2. Use Claude's vision to analyze screenshots and compute parity score (0-100%)
3. If score < 99%, identify gaps and auto-fix
4. Rebuild and repeat until 99% OR diminishing returns OR max iterations

Exit conditions: (1) parity >= 99% = success, (2) <1% improvement for 3 consecutive iterations = diminishing returns, (3) max 10 iterations = safety cap.

On diminishing returns exit: ask user if they want to proceed to ELEVATE anyway.

Saves iteration history (screenshots + scores) to screenshots/verify-iterations/ for debugging.

Implementation: Internal iteration loop within command (not ralph-wiggum style external hooks). Uses Playwright MCP for screenshots. May add visual-parity-checker skill for the vision analysis.

items.title: Permissionless proof pipeline command
items.description:
/pro:permissionless-proof <url> - Run a full permissionless proof pipeline for a live website. Produces a high-fidelity parity rebuild first, then a clean elevated version with modern UI, motion, and polish. Designed for fast outreach and retainers.

Pipeline phases: (1) ACQUIRE - faithful extraction of HTML, assets, screenshots, (2) PARITY - strict mode rebuild matching structure exactly, (3) VERIFY - diff screenshots + structural checklist, (4) ELEVATE - typography, spacing, shadcn/ui, Framer Motion, accessibility.

Output: ./permissionless-proof/{domain}/ with deployable Vite+React codebase, screenshots, diff report, README.

Design decisions: Utility command (no git workflow), new subdirectory output, Vite+React framework, dual verification (visual + structural).

items.title: Add playwriter as alternative browser MCP
items.description: Add playwriter (Chrome extension-based browser automation) as an optional alternative to standard Playwright MCP. Uses wrapper script pattern with USE_PLAYWRITER=1 env var to switch. When enabled, also sets PLAYWRITER_AUTO_ENABLE=1 for automatic tab creation. Default behavior unchanged (standard @playwright/mcp).

items.title: Comprehensive social sharing setup command
items.description: /pro:social - Meta-command that handles complete social sharing setup across all major platforms. Phases: (1) Audit existing metadata, (2) Generate OG image via /pro:og logic, (3) Configure all platform-specific meta tags, (4) Add structured data (JSON-LD) with full schema.org detection, (5) Generate favicon/touch icons from logo if missing, (6) Provide validation links and cache-busting guidance. Supports Next.js, Vite, and plain HTML. Runs unattended where possible.

items.title: Robust content intake for /author:weave
items.description:
Enhance /author:weave to robustly handle diverse content sources:

**URL Capture (Robust):**
- LinkedIn, X/Twitter, blog posts, article URLs
- Per-URL option for extraction depth (main content vs include comments)
- Tiered fallback: WebFetch → Browser automation (Playwright) → Ask user to paste
- Image URLs downloaded and processed

**Image/Screenshot Handling:**
- Auto-analyze image content, match to chapters, propose placement
- Generate 3 caption suggestions for user selection
- Copy images to book/assets/ with manifest.json
- Caption format choice: Markdown or HTML figure

**PDF Support:**
- Full extraction with structure preservation
- Handle multi-page documents

**Google Docs Support (Tiered):**
- Public link access → Browser automation → Export guidance fallback

items.title: Product validation pipeline (brief + validate + pitch)
items.description:
Three-command pipeline for early-stage idea validation:

**`/pro:product.brief`** - Distill unstructured idea material (voice transcriptions, notes, single sentences) into a structured product brief. Extracts problem, solution, target customer, value prop, timing, business model hypothesis.

**`/pro:product.validate`** - Run brutal, no-BS market validation against the brief. Acts like a harsh technical co-founder who destroys weak ideas but confirms strong ones. Uses multi-source research (WebSearch built-in, extensible to Perplexity/Gemini). Produces comprehensive validation report with: market signal analysis, gap analysis, buyer psychology, competitive reality, risk profile, and GO/CAUTION/NO-GO verdict.

**`/pro:product.pitch`** - Generate pitch deck outline from validated product. Uses brief + validation to create 10-slide structure with hook, problem, solution, market, business model, traction, competition, team, ask, and vision.

**Storage:** `.plan/product/` directory with timestamped versioning
**Git required:** No - works in any directory, even pre-repo
**Tone:** Brutally honest, not cruel
**Research APIs:** Extension hooks for Perplexity/Gemini in v1

items.title: Repository health audit command (audit.repo)
items.description: Add /pro:audit.repo command for repository-level security and hygiene auditing. Features: (1) Secrets in git history - scan full history for committed secrets using truffleHog/gitleaks, (2) Sensitive file tracking - verify .gitignore covers common sensitive patterns, (3) Environment file audit - .env vs .env.example consistency, (4) GitHub Actions secrets hygiene - inline credentials in CI config, (5) Public Readiness Score - aggregate go/no-go recommendation. Becomes the single source of truth for secrets scanning - audit.security will call audit.repo instead of duplicating Phase 4.

items.title: PreCompact hook for auto-clear and resume
items.description:
Add PreCompact hook that automatically clears session and resumes via /pro:backlog.resume when auto-compact is about to trigger. Goal: eliminate manual context monitoring and lossy compaction.

**Desired flow:**
1. PreCompact (auto) hook triggers
2. Brief message displayed
3. Session clears automatically
4. /pro:backlog.resume runs automatically

**Blocker:** Claude Code hooks cannot invoke built-in commands like /clear. Feature request submitted to @bcherny on X.

**Fallback (if upstream doesn't support):** Option B - breadcrumb file + SessionStart hook for semi-automatic flow (user types /clear, resume is automatic).
items.blockedReason: Waiting on Claude Code feature request - hooks invoking built-in commands

items.title: Rename writer plugin to author and consolidate import into weave
items.description: Rename the Writer plugin to Author plugin and consolidate commands. Changes: (1) Rename writer/ directory to author/, (2) Update plugin.json name from 'writer' to 'author', (3) Update all /writer:* command references to /author:*, (4) Delete import.md - its functionality is absorbed into weave.md, (5) Enhance weave.md with context-aware bulk mode (empty book = scaffold quickly, existing book = full dialogue), (6) Create ADR documenting the consolidation rationale. The import command became redundant once weave was implemented - weave can detect an empty book and scaffold from H1 headings without the overhead of two separate commands.

items.title: Writer milestones and progress tracking
items.description: Add milestone-based progress tracking to the Writer plugin. Features: (1) /writer:status command - read-only inference dashboard showing progress against targets and milestones, (2) /writer:targets.view and /writer:targets.edit - manage chapter count, word count, and other authoring goals, (3) Book type defaults - infer sensible targets from book type (business, technical, memoir, etc.), (4) Milestone inference - compute which milestones are reached based on content analysis, not explicit marking. Integrates with /writer:init to ask about book type and set initial targets. Design principles: milestones are inferred not declared, no locking, ranges supported for targets, author agency preserved.

items.title: Writer compile command not generating PDF
items.description:
The /writer:compile command generates LaTeX .tex files but does not automatically compile them to PDF via pdflatex, even when pdflatex is installed.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Run `/writer:compile all` on a book project
2. Compilation completes, outputs SpecMD, LaTeX, and Markdown Bundle

**Expected behavior:**
- PDF generated at `book/dist/latex/book.pdf` via automatic pdflatex execution

**Actual behavior:**
- Only `.tex` file generated
- Message says "Ready for PDF compilation with pdflatex" implying manual step needed
- LaTeX treated as final output instead of intermediate format

**Environment:**
- macOS, pdflatex installed (`/opt/homebrew/bin/pdflatex`, TeX Live 2025)

**Root cause:**
- The compile command implementation is not executing the pdflatex compilation step defined in the specification (compile.md lines 203-209)

items.title: MVP command prompts instead of running unattended
items.description:
The /pro:backlog.mvp command prompts for user confirmation at multiple points instead of running through all MVP items unattended.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Run `/pro:backlog.mvp`
2. Command shows MVP scope summary
3. BUG: Command prompts for confirmation to proceed (Step 4 AskUserQuestion)
4. After each item, command prompts for next action [N/P/Q] (Step 7.3)

**Expected behavior:**
- Command runs through ALL MVP items unattended
- Makes a commit at each milestone
- Continues automatically until MVP is complete
- No prompts or questions asked

**Actual behavior:**
- Command prompts for confirmation before starting
- After each item, prompts "[N]ext item | [P]ause | [Q]uit"
- Requires user interaction at multiple points

**Root cause:**
The command definition in `pro/commands/backlog.mvp.md` explicitly includes:
- Step 4: AskUserQuestion to confirm before starting
- Step 7.3: Prompt after each item for next action

items.title: Build in Public - API access for performance tracking
items.description: Add optional X/LinkedIn API integration to track engagement on posted content. Would enable: (1) automatic engagement metrics collection (likes, retweets, comments), (2) learning which content types perform best, (3) adjusting suggestions based on what resonates, (4) analytics dashboard in /pro:bip. Requires OAuth setup and API key management. Deferred until core feature is proven.

items.title: Build-in-public missing subagent component
items.description:
The build-in-public feature was implemented as a skill only, but skills are 'soft invoked' (user still says something). For true zero-friction background content surfacing, a SUBAGENT is required that runs proactively. The skill provides the detailed instructions; the subagent is the background worker that gets invoked automatically.

**Root cause:** Misunderstanding of skill vs subagent semantics. User explicitly requested both components but only skill was created.

**Fix:** Create pro/agents/build-in-public.md subagent definition with 'use PROACTIVELY' in description, update plugin.json with agents directory reference.

items.title: Weave reference material into book chapters
items.description: Add /writer:weave command for incorporating external reference material into a book project. Supports multiple input formats (text, images, PDFs, URLs). Features: (1) Extract and analyze reference content, (2) Source verification via web research, (3) Propose placement with before/after preview, (4) Interactive dialogue for refinement, (5) Citation generation (footnotes or inline), (6) Hybrid reference storage (important refs archived, minor ones cited). Enables pulling inspiration and facts into the book without manual copy-paste and outside weaving.

items.title: Import existing content into Writer book project
items.description: Add /writer:import command for bulk-importing existing markdown content into a book project. Also enhance /writer:init to ask if user has existing content and delegate to import logic. Supports: (1) single markdown file with H1 chapter boundaries, (2) multiple markdown files, (3) auto-detection of preface, chapters, appendix. Creates book structure and populates manifest automatically.

items.title: Marketplace install missing Writer plugin
items.description:
When installing ccplugins from the marketplace, only the Pro plugin is installed. The Writer plugin is missing because `.claude-plugin/marketplace.json` only lists the `pro` plugin in its `plugins` array.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Uninstall ccplugins from Claude Code
2. Reinstall from the marketplace
3. Check installed plugins

**Expected:** Both pro and writer plugins installed
**Actual:** Only pro plugin installed

**Root cause:** marketplace.json was not updated when writer plugin was added in PR #40.

items.title: Writer Plugin PRD
items.description: Markdown-native authoring and publishing plugin for Claude Code. Enables long-form writing workflows (books, essays, guides) with voice-first input, incremental drafting, Git-based version control, and compilation to multiple targets (SpecMD, LaTeX, Markdown bundle). Separates authorship from Pro plugin operations. Anti-features: no WYSIWYG, no CMS, no proprietary formats, no direct publishing.

items.title: Strategic ultrathink integration for complex commands
items.description: Add ultrathink triggers to high-value commands where extended thinking provides material benefit: /pro:audit.security (OWASP analysis), /pro:audit.quality (multi-dimensional analysis), /pro:react.to.next (migration planning), /pro:handoff (comprehensive codebase analysis). Uses hybrid approach with explicit trigger + guidance.

items.title: Build in Public - voice/tone calibration
items.description: Add /pro:bip.setup command for voice personalization. Allow users to calibrate the tone of generated content by providing example posts or selecting from preset styles. Could analyze existing social media posts to learn the user's voice. Deferred from v1 to keep initial implementation simple.

items.title: Build in Public - auto-surface shareable content
items.description: Pro Plugin skill that automatically surfaces notable development moments and drafts shareable content for X and LinkedIn. Features: (1) Skill-based auto-invocation during normal work, (2) Inline suggestions with defer option, (3) Configurable confidence threshold, (4) Fingerprint-based deduplication, (5) Pending queue for deferred items, (6) Draft-only output (manual copy-paste to platforms). Storage at .plan/build-in-public/. Turns 'building in public' into a byproduct of real work.

items.title: /pro:spike git worktree example uses hardcoded path
items.description: In pro/commands/spike.md lines 24-35, the git worktree tip creates a worktree using $(basename $PWD)--experiment but the cd and remove commands hardcode 'project--experiment'. Should use $(basename $PWD)--experiment consistently.

items.title: Comprehensive security audit command
items.description: Add /pro:audit.security command for deep security analysis. Features: (1) CVE scanning via multiple tools (npm audit, pip-audit, cargo audit, etc.) with merged results, (2) OWASP Top 10 static analysis covering all categories A01-A10, (3) Secrets scanning in current files AND git history using truffleHog/gitleaks, (4) Framework-specific attack vector analysis with severity weighting, (5) Compliance-style report with scores + detailed findings, (6) Graceful degradation when tools unavailable. Far more comprehensive than /pro:audit's basic security checks.

items.title: Git worktree integration for agent sandboxing
items.description: Explore using git worktrees to create isolated sandboxes for Claude agents. Inspired by DHH's workflow where `ga fix` creates a worktree+branch and `gd` destroys it. Goals: (1) parallel isolation - agents work without touching user's current branch, (2) multi-agent sandboxes - multiple agents working in parallel, (3) safer experimentation - spike work fully isolated from main.
items.resolution: Added tip to /pro:spike command documenting git worktrees for full isolation. No new commands needed - pattern already supported by Claude Code.

items.title: /pro:dev.setup gitignore ignores entire .dev/ directory
items.description: The /pro:dev.setup command is adding .dev/ to gitignore (ignoring entire directory) instead of only ignoring .dev/pid.json and .dev/log/. This causes .dev/servers.json and .dev/README.md to not be tracked by git, which blocks team sharing of configuration. Root cause: Phase 5 instructions are ambiguous and don't explicitly warn against adding .dev/ as catch-all.

items.title: /pro:git.main - Standardize default branch to main
items.description: Add /pro:git.main command that standardizes a repository's default branch name to 'main'. Features: inspection-first workflow, safety gates (uncommitted changes, existing main branch, detached HEAD, permissions), explicit phrase confirmation 'CONFIRM RENAME TO MAIN', pre-check via gh api for permissions, support for local-only repos with adjusted behavior.

items.title: React to Next.js migration command
items.description: Add /pro:react.to.next command that converts client-rendered React applications into Next.js applications using a deterministic, auditable migration pipeline. Key features: in-place migration preserving git history, App Router default with Pages Router fallback, guaranteed route safety (no valid URL may 404), guided prompt-based execution, preflight detection engine, and comprehensive migration documentation.

items.title: Consider splitting /pro:gaps into analyze and fix commands
items.description: The current /pro:gaps command both analyzes gaps AND creates branches to fix them. Consider whether this should be two separate commands for clearer purpose: one for analysis/verification only, and one for addressing identified gaps.

items.title: /pro:readme - No Offline Mode
items.description: If network is unavailable, badge and link validation will fail. Currently warns user and proceeds with syntax-only checks. Could cache validation results or provide explicit offline mode flag.

items.title: /pro:readme - No Badge Preview Images
items.description: When proposing badges, we describe them but don't show actual rendered previews. Currently shows text descriptions. Could use terminal image rendering or generate a preview document.

items.title: /pro:readme - No README Templates for Specific Frameworks
items.description: Dynamic generation works well but some frameworks (Next.js, Rails, etc.) have community-standard README patterns. Currently uses generic structure adapted to project type. Could add optional framework-specific templates.

items.title: /pro:readme - No Automated Section Ordering
items.description: When generating sections, the order is hardcoded rather than learned from the ecosystem. Currently uses fixed section order based on common patterns. Could analyze popular repositories to determine optimal ordering.

items.title: /pro:readme - No Diff Visualization
items.description: Changes are described in text but not shown as an actual diff. Currently summarizes changes in categories (sections, badges, links). Could show side-by-side or unified diff format.

items.title: /pro:readme - No CI/CD Badge Auto-Detection for all providers
items.description: Currently checks for GitHub Actions but not all CI providers. Could detect CircleCI, Travis CI, GitLab CI, etc.

items.title: PRD/spec intake workflow - backlog preservation
items.description: Need a way to parse multi-story specs/PRDs and persist backlog without losing stories that aren't immediately worked on. Current /pro:feature is designed for single features. When given a full PRD with epics and user stories, there's no persistence layer for 'the rest'. Options: make /pro:feature smart enough to detect PRDs and create backlog, or introduce a separate command (e.g., /pro:roadmap). Must avoid command sprawl while not bloating /pro:feature.

items.title: New work-type commands and spec ingestion layer
items.description: Introduce /pro:spike (exploratory work), /pro:chore (maintenance work), /pro:spec.import (ingest and persist specs), and /pro:spec (view imported specs). Codify branch-naming invariant: all work-initiating commands create branches with intent-appropriate prefixes. This addresses backlog item #8 by providing lossless spec ingestion with auto-parsing of epics/stories to backlog.

items.title: MVP cut line workflow with MoSCoW prioritization
items.description: Add MVP awareness to the backlog system using MoSCoW notation (MUST/SHOULD/COULD/WONT). Enhance /pro:spec.import to detect MoSCoW markers. Create /pro:backlog.mvp command to run through all MVP items in a single branch. Update /pro:backlog to show phase badges and select MVP items by default. Infer phase from severity when no explicit markers exist.

items.title: Rename plugin description from Product Planning to Product Owner
items.description: Change plugin.json description field from 'Product Planning' to 'Product Owner' to better reflect the plugin's purpose as a Product Owner toolkit.
